ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 75
ygData.msgSnippet: Sorry to throw this in here like this but I am asking EVERYBODY in the hopes of finding SOMEBODY who knows all the info on a Barbarian 1 handed slashing weapon
ygData.messageBody:
Sorry to throw this in here like this but I am asking EVERYBODY in the hopes of
finding SOMEBODY who knows all the info on a Barbarian 1 handed slashing
weapon called the Langseax. I have the stats. What I need to know is how do I
go about getting one? Thank for your help and tolerance. 8)


EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com wrote:

> --------------------------- ONElist Sponsor ----------------------------

> Topics in today's digest:

> 1. banded gloves
> From: tiggy <tiggy@...>
> 2. Re: banded gloves

> Message: 1
> Date: Sat, 07 Aug 1999 01:50:32 -0400
> From: tiggy <tiggy@...>
> Subject: banded gloves
>
> Greetings all....
> One quick question. I have been doing smithing for what seems like
> forever and am way above master level. However, in all my time of smithing
> I have yet to see or find a mold for banded gloves though I've had many
> MANY customers request them. Does anyone know if banded gloves even exist
> and if so are there molds to make them or must they be bought from
> merchant...and if there are molds to make them...where the heck are they
> hiding them?? lol Thanks much for any help. ;)
>
> Twilite
>
> _______________________________________________________________________________
> _______________________________________________________________________________
>
> Message: 2
> Date: Sat, 7 Aug 1999 01:39:59 -0500
> From: "Reedo" <reedo@...>
> Subject: Re: banded gloves
>
> This truely is a pain but there are no banded gloves to be made. I've sold
> several people full suits of banded and then here "You forgot the gloves."
> Then I have to explain to them that there are no banded gloves. It really
> is a pain. I don't know if they forgot or did it on purpose but it would
> have been nice to make them. The best you can do is get ringmail or chain
> to go along with the banded. I
>
> Mark
>
